question.title: Excel Column number
question.content:
You have been given a column title as appears in an Excel sheet, return its corresponding column number.

For example:
A -> 1
B -> 2
C -> 3
...
Z -> 26
AA -> 27
AB -> 28 
...
Input Format
The only line of input contains a string S i.e. column title
Constraints:
1 <= |S| <= 10
Input contains only uppercase English Alphabet letters

Time Limit : 1 sec
Output Format
The only line of output will print the column number corresponding to given column title
Sample Input 1
AB
Sample Output 1
28
Sample Input 2
ZZZ
Sample Output 2
18278

rephrased.body: Given a column title as it appears in an Excel sheet, convert it into its corresponding column number. For example, 'A' corresponds to 1, 'B' to 2, 'Z' to 26, 'AA' to 27, and so on.
constraints: Input contains only uppercase English Alphabet letters

testcases.explanation: The column title 'AB' represents the 28th column (A=1, B=2, so 1*26 + 2 = 28).
The column title 'ZZZ' represents the 18278th column (26*26*26 + 26*26 + 26 = 18278).
The column title 'A' represents the 1st column.
The column title 'Z' represents the 26th column.
The column title 'AA' represents the 27th column (26*1 + 1 = 27).
The column title 'CDA' represents the 2229th column (3*26*26 + 4*26 + 1 = 2028 + 104 + 1 = 2133).
The column title 'BCM' represents the 1451th column (2*26*26 + 3*26 + 13 = 1352 + 78 + 13 = 1443).

hints: Think of the question as converting a binary number into decimal form.
